channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: I'd resign if I wasn't still right for job - Howe
item.description: Eddie Howe says there is "no doubt in my mind" he is still the right manager for Newcastle despite one win in eight games.

item.title: 'Killjoy' - did VAR get late drama in Liverpool v Man City right?
item.description: Manchester City's win at Liverpool ended in complete chaos - but did the referee and the VAR get Dominik Szoboszlai's red card right?

item.title: Tottenham in relegation battle, says Rooney
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur are in a relegation battle, says former England captain Wayne Rooney.

item.title: Rangers to host Celtic in Scottish Cup quarter-finals
item.description: Rangers host Old Firm rivals Celtic and holders Aberdeen face a potential trip to Dunfermline in the Scottish Cup quarter-finals.

item.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
item.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

item.title: Tonali high on Man Utd shortlist - Monday's gossip
item.description: Sandro Tonali high on Manchester United's shortlist to replace Casrmiro, Liverpool open to letting Federico Chiesa leave, Tottenham do not intend to turn Randal Kolo Muani's loan move permanent, plus more.

item.title: Man City produce late comeback to beat Liverpool in chaotic finale
item.description: Erling Haaland's 93rd-minute penalty gives Manchester City a crucial comeback win over Liverpool, who end the game with 10 men as Dominik Szoboszlai is sent off in stoppage time at Anfield.

item.title: 'The hope is there' - how Man City 'just' kept themselves in title race
item.description: A generation of Manchester City supporters has not experienced a winning feeling at Anfield, but all that changed on a highly dramatic Sunday evening as they fought back for a thrilling 2-1 Premier League victory.

item.title: 'Rules are rules!' Why chaotic Cherki goal was disallowed
item.description: Match of the Day's Mark Chapman, Wayne Rooney and Joe Hart discuss Rayan Cherki's disallowed goal in Manchester City's 2-1 win over Liverpool at Anfield.

item.title: Was VAR disallowing Cherki goal 'anti-football'?
item.description: Wayne Rooney, Kae Kurd, Kelly Somers and the BBC's football issues correspondent Dale Johnson dissect the decision to disallow Rayan Cherki's late goal in Manchester City's 2-1 win over Liverpool at Anfield.

item.title: Szoboszlai free-kick 'an absolute work of art' - Hart
item.description: Match of the Day's Joe Hart breaks down Dominik Szoboszlai's stunning free-kick in Liverpool's 2-1 Premier League defeat to Manchester City.

item.title: Crystal Palace end winless run with victory over rivals Brighton
item.description: Ismaila Sarr scores the only goal of the game as Crystal Palace end a run of nine Premier League games without a win, by beating rivals Brighton 1-0 at the AMEX Stadium.

item.title: Slot bemoans luck with referees in loss to Man City
item.description: Liverpool manager Arne Slot says the club have had poor luck with referees this season, believing that Marc Guehi should have been sent off for a challenge on Mohamed Salah in their loss to Manchester City.

item.title: 'I know who I am' - Chelsea boss Bompastor defiant after tough week
item.description: Chelsea manager Sonia Bompastor has not had many tougher weeks in her managerial career and was defiant following their win at Tottenham.

item.title: Smith's versatility and 'contagious' positivity driving Arsenal
item.description: Olivia Smith's talent and versatility is helping to kick-start a drifting Arsenal side back into life as they chase silverware on three fronts.

item.title: Five years of Hollywood - Wrexham's transformation
item.description: BBC Sport Wales looks at how Wrexham have evolved since being taken over by Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney five years ago.

item.title: Can you name the players with most Premier League appearances?
item.description: James Milner is poised to equal the record for most Premier League appearances.

item.title: The new top-flight Canadian club inspired by Athletic Bilbao
item.description: Supra du Quebec kick off their inaugural Canadian Premier League in April and will field only players born or raised in the province.

item.title: How Ekitike has already become a Liverpool cult hero
item.description: Inside the rise of Hugo Ekitike, adapting to life in England, connecting with Florian Wirtz and why he's already a fan favourite.

item.title: Barry-Murphy criticises League One refereeing standards
item.description: Cardiff boss Brian Barry-Murphy says refereeing in League One is "getting gradually worse" following his side's 10-man victory over Rotherham.

item.title: Arsenal end Man City's 13-game winning streak
item.description: Watch highlights of Arsenal's 1-0 win over Manchester City as Olivia Smith's strike inflicts City's first Women's Super League defeat since the opening day of the season.

item.title: Chelsea see off Tottenham to move third in WSL
item.description: Goals from Keira Walsh and Alyssa Thompson ease Chelsea to a 2-0 victory over Tottenham to move the Blues third in the WSL.

item.title: Watch all eight goals as Rangers dismantle Queen's Park
item.description: James Tavernier scores his first hat-trick as Rangers blow away Queen's Park in the Scottish Cup.

item.title: 'It hurts me deep' - Cuthbert on Chelsea's form
item.description: Cheslea's Erin Cuthbert says costly defeats by Arsenal and Manchester City "hurt" and have affected her sleep.

item.title: Liverpool move off bottom of WSL with 4-1 win
item.description: Liverpool move off the foot of the Women's Super League table as late goals from captain Grace Fisk and substitute Aurelie Csillag cap a dominant display against Aston Villa.

item.title: Liverpool signing Jacquet injures shoulder
item.description: Defender Jeremy Jacquet, who will join Liverpool at the end of the season, injures a shoulder in Rennes' defeat at Lens.

item.title: Cleworth's rise from National League to brink of Premier League
item.description: Max Cleworth becomes the club's leading appearance-maker during Phil Parkinson's tenure in Wrexham's defeat against Millwall.

item.title: Are West Ham single-handedly making relegation battle interesting?
item.description: BBC Sport looks at how things are shaping up as the fight for Premier League survival hots up.

item.title: 'I'm not doing my job well enough' - but is Howe now under pressure?
item.description: Newcastle boss Eddie Howe admitted he is "not doing my job well enough" after Saturday's defeat by Brentford - but is he under pressure?

item.title: Leicester's nightmare week and Millwall push for top two - Sam Parkin's EFL takeaways
item.description: EFL pundit Sam Parkin delivers his verdict on the happenings across the EFL, from the promotion battles to the relegation scraps.

item.title: 'Unstoppable at his best' - is Palmer in World Cup picture after hat-trick?
item.description: By scoring a first-half hat-trick against Wolves on Saturday, Cole Palmer provided a timely reminder of his talent, putting himself firmly in the England conversation.

item.title: How 'irresponsible' captain Romero's week ended in 'perfect storm'
item.description: Thomas Frank admits Tottenham captain Cristian Romero's week ended in a "perfect storm" with a red card at Manchester United.

item.title: Wigan sack Lowe after 11 months in charge
item.description: Wigan Athletic sack Ryan Lowe after 11 months in charge with the Latics in the League One relegation zone.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v Gladiators star Apollo
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on Gladiators star Apollo and AI with his predictions for this week's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: 'Why young British managers need lower-league experience'
item.description: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis explains why he thinks there is a negative reaction to British managers when they get jobs in the Premier League - and the path young coaches should take.

item.title: Inside Man City's rebuild and plan for life without Guardiola
item.description: BBC Sport looks at Manchester City's evolution and why the January window has offered renewed belief.

item.title: The talented playmaker no-one seems to want
item.description: Harvey Elliott is one of England's most gifted young players - but neither Aston Villa or Liverpool appear to rate the midfielder.

item.title: 'Strong and smart' - Liverpool's £60m man, who can 'become like Van Dijk'
item.description: Jeremy Jacquet will join Liverpool for £60m from Rennes in the summer - but why are the Reds signing him?

item.title: The most powerful woman in football - meet game's first female super agent
item.description: Super agent Rafaela Pimenta looks after some of the biggest names in the game - and has spoken exclusively to the BBC.

item.title: All February's done deals, including deadline day, in one place
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: What do you get for winning EFL Cup?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what the winner of the Carabao Cup gets.

item.title: When is transfer deadline day around the world?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain when the transfer deadline is set around the world.

item.title: How many players are clubs allowed to loan out?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explain the rules around how many players clubs are allowed to send out on loan

item.title: What happens during a football medical?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explain what is involved in a medical exam when a football player joins a new club.

item.title: What is a transfer deal sheet?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at what a transfer deal sheet is and why it is needed for transfers on deadline day.

item.title: How much do teams earn for reaching Champions League knockouts?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team breaks down how much money Premier League teams have received by advancing to the knockout phase of the competition.

item.title: Which countries haven't had a Premier League player?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore which countries have not been represented in the Premier League.

item.title: Aberdeen still in talks with Horneland over managerial vacancy - gossip
item.description: Aberdeen remain locked in talks with Eirik Horneland over their managerial vacancy, plus Celtic could claim bumper ticket allocation for Scottish Cup trip to Rangers.

item.title: Quiz: Name the record transfer for every letter of the alphabet
item.description: When it comes to transfer windows, it's not all about the numbers - the letters are important too!

item.title: Lookman joins Atletico - and will set new record
item.description: Atletico Madrid sign Nigeria forward Ademola Lookman, 28, from Atalanta for £30.3m.

item.title: Real and England wait on Bellingham injury
item.description: Real Madrid are waiting to discover if midfielder Jude Bellingham faces a spell out after he suffers a muscle injury during the win against Rayo Vallecano.

item.title: Arsenal defender Zinchenko seals move to Ajax
item.description: Ajax sign Arsenal's Oleksandr Zinchenko on a permanent deal after the defender's season-long loan with Nottingham Forest is brought to an early end.

item.title: Barca president unhappy at teen's 'unpleasant' PSG move
item.description: PSG sign 18-year-old Barcelona midfielder Dro Fernandez, with the Spanish side's president calling the situation around the transfer "unpleasant".

item.title: The Basque derby - the friendliest rivalry in world football?
item.description: With a sense of shared identity and fans mixing in the stands, is the Basque derby between Athletic Club and Real Sociedad the friendliest in the world?

item.title: Cages, crushes and stabbings - is European away safety getting worse?
item.description: BBC Sport explores the safety issues fans face when following their team across Europe.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.
